result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnathon M Lilteich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challege Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 149 days sentence credit.
AMENDED 01-20-2016:  Apply 319 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Count 6.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution ($4,142.44) is to be paid joint and severally as a Condition of Extended Supervision and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Court costs ($278) and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

04/19/16 COURT MODIFIES PAYMENTS FOR COSTS/FINES/SURCHARGES TO BE PAID WHILE ON EXTENDED SUPERVISION AND NOT WITH PRISON MONIES. EVERYTHING ELSE REMAINS AS PREVIOUSLY ORDERED.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Submit to random urine screens. No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.

Defendant Johnathon M Lilteich in court, in custody, with attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court imposed the following sentence as to count1 and 6:
 
Total sentence: 8 years (Initial Confinement: 4 years, Extended Supervision: 4 years)  as to each count to run concurrent with each other
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- Ct. 1 - Court costs of $278.00 and $250.00 DNA Surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. 
- Ct. 6 - Court costs of $268.00 and $250.00 DNA Surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. 
- Defendant granted 149 days credit already served

- Conditions of Extended Supervision: 
 Defendant to provide DNR sample
 Restitution in the amount of $4142.44 to be joint and severally
Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs. No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken in the manner they were prescribed. Follow thru with any treatment/counseling/conditions recommended by Agent.
Sentencing hearing on May 29, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pending Sentencing.
